# @eppi-centreReviewGuidelinesExtracting2003 & @criticalappraisalskillsprogrammeCASPSystematicReview2018

### If the study has a broad focus and this data extraction focuses on just one component of the study, please specify this here
 
- [x] Not applicable (whole study is focus of data extraction)  

## Study aim(s) and rationale

### Was the study informed by, or linked to, an existing body of empirical and/or theoretical research?

- [x] Explicitly stated (please specify)  

The study was informed by existing research on stereotype threat, working memory, and choking under pressure. The authors cite multiple studies showing that stereotype threat hinders performance by reducing working memory capacity.

### Do authors report how the study was funded?

- [x] Not stated/unclear (please specify)

The authors do not report any funding information for this study.

## Study research question(s) and its policy or practice focus

### What is/are the topic focus/foci of the study?

The study focuses on stereotype threat effects on women's performance in logical reasoning, and how individual differences in working memory capacity moderate these effects.

### What is/are the population focus/foci of the study?

The population focus is on male and female engineering students in France.

### What is the relevant age group? 

- [x] 21 and over  

The mean age of participants was 21 years.

### What is the sex of the population focus/foci?

- [x] Mixed sex  

The study included both male and female participants.

### What is/are the educational setting(s) of the study?

- [x] Higher education institution  

The participants were engineering students at selective engineering schools.

### In Which country or cuntries was the study carried out?

- [x] Explicitly stated (please specify)  

The study was carried out in France.

### Please describe in more detail the specific phenomena, factors, services, or interventions with which the study is concerned

The study examines how stereotype threat affects women's performance on a logical reasoning task (Raven's Advanced Progressive Matrices), and how individual differences in working memory capacity moderate this effect.

### What are the study research questions and/or hypotheses?

- [x] Implicit (please specify)  

The implicit research question is whether women with high working memory capacity are more able to resist stereotype threat effects compared to women with low working memory capacity.

## Methods - Design

### Which variables or concepts, if any, does the study aim to measure or examine?

- [x] Explicitly stated (please specify)  

The study measures:
1. Working memory capacity (using a reading span task)
2. Logical reasoning ability (using Raven's Advanced Progressive Matrices)
3. Stereotype threat condition (diagnostic vs. diagnostic but gender fair)

### Study timing

- [x] Cross-sectional  

The study collected data at a single time point.

### If the study is an evaluation, when were measurements of the variable(s) used for outcome made, in relation to the intervention?

- [x] Only after  

The outcome measure (logical reasoning performance) was taken after the stereotype threat manipulation.

## Methods - Groups

### If comparisons are being made between two or more groups, please specify the basis of any divisions made for making these comparisons.

- [x] Prospecitive allocation into more than one group (e.g. allocation to different interventions, or allocation to intervention and control groups)  

Participants were randomly assigned to either the "diagnostic" or "diagnostic but gender fair" condition.

### How do the groups differ?

- [x] Explicityly stated (please specify)  

The groups differ in the instructions given for the logical reasoning task. One group was told the test was "diagnostic" of logical reasoning ability, while the other group was told it was "diagnostic but gender fair".

### Number of groups

- [x] Two  

There were two experimental groups based on the stereotype threat manipulation.

### Was the assignment of participants to interventions randomised?

- [x] Random  

Participants were randomly assigned to the two experimental conditions.

### Where there was prospective allocation to more than one group, was the allocation sequence concealed from participants and those enrolling them until after enrolment?

- [x] Not stated/unclear (please specify)  

The paper does not provide information on whether the allocation sequence was concealed.

### Apart from the experimental intervention, did each study group receive the same level of care (that is, were they treated equally)?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No
- [x] Can't tell

The paper does not provide enough information to determine if the groups were treated equally apart from the experimental manipulation.

### Study design summary 

This was a cross-sectional experimental study with random assignment to two groups differing in stereotype threat instructions. The study examined how working memory capacity (measured pre-test) moderated the effects of stereotype threat on women's logical reasoning performance.

## Results and Conclusions

### How are the results of the study presented?

- [x] Details

Results are presented through regression coefficients and a figure showing accuracy scores as a function of threat condition, gender, and working memory capacity.

### What are the results of the study as reported by authors?

- [x] Details

The authors found a significant three-way interaction between gender, threat condition, and working memory capacity. Low working memory women showed stereotype threat effects, performing worse in the diagnostic condition than in the gender-fair condition. High working memory women and men showed no stereotype threat effects.

### Was the precision of the estimate of the intervention or treatment effect reported?
   - CONSIDER:
     - Were confidence intervals (CIs) reported?
   - [ ] Yes
   - [x] No
   - [ ] Can't tell

The authors report regression coefficients and p-values, but do not report confidence intervals.

### Are there any obvious shortcomings in the reporting of the data?

- [x] Yes (please specify)

The authors do not report effect sizes or confidence intervals, which would provide more information about the precision and practical significance of their findings.

### Do the authors report on all variables they aimed to study as specified in their aims/research questions?

- [x] Yes (please specify)

The authors report on all variables mentioned in their research question: gender, stereotype threat condition, working memory capacity, and logical reasoning performance.

### Do the authors state where the full original data are stored?

- [x] No

The authors do not provide information on data storage or availability.

### What do the author(s) conclude about the findings of the study?

- [x] Details

The authors conclude that stereotype threat effects are moderated by working memory capacity, with only low working memory women showing stereotype threat effects. They suggest that this provides the first direct evidence that stereotype threat differs from choking under pressure, as high working memory individuals were able to resist stereotype threat.
